title: How to Make Table Placemats from Cloth

steps.headline: Decide on the size.
steps.description: Cut two rectangles in the desired mat size plus 0.5 inches (1.3 cm) on all sides to allow for seams.

steps.headline: Position the fabric for sewing.
steps.description: Sew the two rectangles with printed or "right" sides facing together, leaving a 3–4 inches (7.6–10.2 cm) open unstitched space for turning.

steps.headline: Remove corners for turning.
steps.description: Miter the corners by cutting a wedge off each corner. This helps the placemat lie flat for the next step.

steps.headline: Pull fabric through the open unstitched space.
Flatten the seam allowance at the opening.
Add finishing stitches.
steps.description: Top stitch around the perimeter. Use a zig zag stitch with contrasting thread for a decorative touch.

steps.headline: Congratulations!
steps.description: You have just sewn a placemat!
